text: Daniel Ivan Hicks (December 9, 1941 â€“ February 6, 2016) was an American singer-songwriter and musician. He made music with elements of cowboy folk, jazz, country, swing, bluegrass, pop and gypsy. He led the band Dan Hicks and His Hot Licks. His career began in 1965. He was best known for the songs "I Scare Myself" and "Canned Music." His songs were known for having humor. One of his songs was titled "How Can I Miss You When You Won't Go Away?" His latest album, Live at Davies, was released in 2013. Hicks died on February 6, 2016 from throat and liver cancer. He died in Mill Valley, California. He was 74 years old. He was diagnosed with throat cancer in 2014 and had liver cancer since 2015. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American bandleaders Category:American bluegrass musicians Category:Country musicians from Arkansas Category:American folk musicians Category:American pop musicians Category:American pop singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Deaths from throat cancer Category:Musicians from Little Rock, Arkansas Category:Singers from Arkansas
title: Dan Hicks (singer)
